tern 0.5.0.2
  • Reference
  • Changelog

List of Events Terms Tables By Highest Grade (One Level Term only)

lt_events_per_term_grade_id_1.Rd

lt_events_per_term_grade_id_1 returns a nested list of events tables by max grade (t_max_grade_per_id).

lt_events_per_term_grade_id_1(term, id, grade, col_by, col_N,
  total = "All Patients", grade_levels)

Arguments

term

term information as character or factor, however factor levels are not repeated by class, only terms with count > 1 are listed per class. var_relabel is used as the character string used as a label in the column header for each term.
id

vector of subject identifier. Length of id must be the same as the length or number of rows of terms.
grade

grade of adverse event as numeric. var_relabel is used as the character string used as a label in the column header for each grade.
col_by

group variable that will be used for a column header. col_by has to be a factor and can not be missing. See 'Examples'.
col_N

numeric vector with information of the number of patients in the levels of col_by. This is useful if there are patients that have no adverse events can be accounted for with this argument.
total

character string that will be used as a label for a column with pooled total population, default is "All Patients". If the levels of col_by are the only columns of interest then total should be NULL
grade_levels

numeric, ordered values of possible of grades in a form of x:y, default is 1:5.

Details

The data is split and table functions are applied to leaf nodes as follows:

Examples


library(dplyr)
library(random.cdisc.data)

ASL <- rasl(10, seed = 1)
AAE <- raae(ASL, 4, seed = 2)

ANL <- left_join(AAE, ASL %>% select(USUBJID, STUDYID, ARM), by = c("USUBJID", "STUDYID"))

l_tbls <- tern:::lt_events_per_term_grade_id_1(
  term = ANL$AEDECOD,
  id = ANL$USUBJID,
  grade = ANL$AETOXGR,
  col_by = ANL$ARM,
  col_N = table(ASL$ARM),
  total = "All Patients",
  grade_levels = 1:5
)

do.call(fast_stack_rtables, l_tbls)
#>                                                        A: Drug X             B: Placebo          C: Combination         All Patients
